articles.title: Congratulations to Greek PM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Greek PM
						
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju sent a congratulatory message to Alexis Tsipras on Sept. 25 upon his stay in office as prime minister of Greece.
					 The message wished him success in his work for the stability and economic development of the country.
					
					 Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong also sent a similar message to Nicos Kotzias upon his reappointment as foreign minister of Greece on the same day.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets Foreign Heads of State
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets Foreign Heads of State
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Ri Su Yong, DPRK foreign minister, who is participating in the 70th UN General Assembly met heads of state of various countries.
					 Ri on September 25 met and had a talk with Raul Castro Ruz, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba.
					
					 The president extended sincere thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Un for receiving the first vice-president of the Council of State of Cuba during his visit to the DPRK.
					
					 Ri Su Yong met the president of South Africa, the prime minister of Lesotho and the foreign minister of Iran.
					
					 The president of South Africa reiterated his will to boost the friendly relations between the two countries and strengthen many-sided cooperation and exchange.
					
					 The prime minister of Lesotho said that he would make positive efforts to develop the bilateral relations on a higher stage, requesting Ri to convey his sincere greetings to Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The foreign minister of Iran expressed his gratitude to the DPRK government and people for having voiced invariable support and solidarity for the just cause of the Iranian people.
					
					 The DPRK foreign minister separately met the Bolivian and Mozambican presidents, the chancellor of Germany, the prime minister of Fiji, the vice-prime minister of Nepal and foreign ministers of Angola, Algeria, Mongolia, Kazakhstan, Sweden and Tunisia and exchanged views on a series of issues of mutual concern.
					
					 Meanwhile, Ri met and had a talk with the president of the UN General Assembly.

articles.title: CPRK Denounces Reckless Remarks of S. Korean Chief Executive
articles.content:
CPRK Denounces Reckless Remarks of S. Korean Chief Executive
						
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea (CPRK) released a statement on Tuesday lashing out at the repeated reckless remarks made by the south Korean chief executive inciting confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north at the UN.
					 The statement said: The south Korean chief executive in her "keynote speech" at the 70th session of the UN General Assembly let loose such invectives that the "nukes of the north constitute a top priority task for building a world without nuclear weapons", "the north's additional provocation is aimed at vitiating the atmosphere of the inter-Korean dialogue and hamstringing the efforts of the countries concerned with the six-party talks for resuming the dialogue for denuclearization and "the north would be well advised to strive to help its residents overcome difficulties through reform and opening instead of making an additional provocation."
					
					 Not content with hurting the DPRK's dignity and social system, vociferating about "requirement of the international community" and the "urging the improvement of human rights," she openly revealed her ambition to achieve "unification through absorption" with the backing of foreign forces under the pretext of "peaceful unification",.
					
					 This is an unpardonable provocation to the DPRK and a heinous confrontation act of chilling the hard-won atmosphere of improving the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 A string of silly remarks made by her clearly prove that she is utterly bereft of reason, hell-bent on sycophancy towards the U.S. and confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north.
					
					 She is so reckless as to take issue with the DPRK's nuclear deterrent, a treasured sword of justice for defending the nation while keeping mum about nukes of her American master, the cancer-like harasser of the global peace. This is no more than a sheer jargon of the chief executive, colonial servant who is so steeped in sycophancy towards the U.S. to the marrow of her bones that she does not know what she should support and what she should oppose.
					
					 It is the height of shamelessness for her to impudently talk about someone's "human rights" and "living of residents," pretending not to know about south Korea being denounced as the world's worst tundra of human rights.
					
					 What was funny was that she made no scruple of telling cock-and bull-story that she was dreaming of the arrival of the day when "the world would hail the unification of the Korean Peninsula" just as the U.N. "greeted" the tragic day when the U.S. puppet regime was installed. This is something that provokes a side-splitting laughter.
					
					 In fact, this was an open revelation of the wild ambition to achieve "unification of social systems," a foolish act of driving this land into a war and inviting self-ruin.
					
					 We had already served a stern warning to the south Korean authorities that they would have to pay dearly for their reckless remarks.
					
					  Due to the south Korean authorities' reckless confrontation row not only the north-south relations but the reunion of separated families and relatives in the north and the south now being promoted with much effort has been put at serious peril.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities let loose a string of confrontational invectives as now, the event may prove completely abortive. 
					
					 This is the unanimous view of the public at home and abroad.
					
					 We stand for improved north-south relations but have no idea of continuing to show leniency even to the partner who is persistently pursuing confrontation, turning down our offer of reconciliation and magnanimity. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities should apologize to the nation for recklessly slandering the fellow countrymen and learn how to properly wag their tongues, bearing in mind that their provocative words and deeds may cause unpredictable misfortune at this crucial time.

articles.title: Saemaul Junior Secondary School
articles.content:
Saemaul Junior Secondary School
						
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Saemaul Junior Secondary School in Phyongchon District, Pyongyang is well known throughout the country for producing rhythmic gymnastic elites.
					 The school won the first place for 28 times in the rhythmic gymnastic event of the annual National Schoolchildren's Sports Contest for Jongilbong Prize.
					
					 It has attached great importance to developing rhythmic gymnastics on a scientific basis from long ago. It has an excellent rhythmic gymnastic hall fully equipped with more than 200 training aids.
					
					 Such achievements are attributable to the painstaking efforts of Pak Hyang Suk, a drill master of the school with nearly 40 years' experience.
					
					 A number of her trainees have been singled out by several sports teams and many of them proved successful at different international games.
					
					 Pak wrote a book on eurhythmic training and was awarded two certificates in new education method. She is also the winner of the title of October 8 Model Professor.

articles.title: Animals on Increase in Central Zoo
articles.content:
Animals on Increase in Central Zoo
						
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Animals are on the increase in the Central Zoo of the DPRK, which is being spruced up on an expansion basis.
					 This year alone, over 370 animals of 90 species have been brought to the zoo, which include newcomers of more than 50 species like Hyaena striata, Taurotragus oryx and Cygnus olor.
					
					 Meanwhile, at least 400 animals of 100 species have been reproduced in the zoo.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S. Forces in S. Korea of Posing Threat to Global Peace and Security
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S. Forces in S. Korea of Posing Threat to Global Peace and Security
						
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- U.S. military bases in different parts of the world serve as advanced bases for aggression to contain by force of arms those countries which incur its displeasure and the U.S. forces present there are a cancer-like entity wrecking global peace and security, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a commentary.
					 This is clearly evidenced by what is happening in south Korea, the biggest nuclear advanced base in the world, it notes, and goes on: 
					
					  The U.S. set up military bases and keeps its forces in south Korea. They are not for "defense" and "peace and security" but carrying out the aggressive policy against Korea and strategy for dominating the world, 
					
					 The U.S. forces in south Korea are the main forces which pose a threat to the peace and security not only on the Korean Peninsula and in Northeast Asia and the world.
					
					 The reality goes to prove that global peace will be exposed to constant threat and mankind will suffer a war disaster any time as long as the U.S. keeps its military bases in different parts of the world.
					
					 It is by no means fortuitous that many countries of the world express concern over the fact that the U.S. military bases and units are factors of escalating the danger of a war.
					
					 It makes no sense to talk about the peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and in Northeast Asia as long as the U.S. forces are present in south Korea.
					
					 The withdrawal of the U.S. forces from south Korea is the only way of promoting global peace and security on the peninsula and in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 The U.S. should bear this in mind and lend its ears to this for its own sake.

articles.title: U.S. Has No Future: Minju Joson
articles.content:
U.S. Has No Future: Minju Joson 
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- It was recently reported that the internet website of University of Zurich "International Security Net" posted an article saying that the U.S. position is now gradually sinking in the international arena and the U.S. will finally lose its unchallenged position several decades later.
					 Minju Joson Tuesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The U.S. is not getting stronger but declining as the days go by due to its persistent pursuance of highhanded politics as unanimously acknowledged by world political experts and public opinion. 
					
					 In a word, the U.S.-led unipolar domination system goes totally bust and the era of multi-polarization is arriving. 
					
					 The world is heading for multi-polarization and independence has become a trend of the present times whether the U.S. likes or not. 
					
					 The U.S. has neither capability nor method to stem the strong trend towards independence desired by mankind. 
					
					 The U.S. is still bluffing, resorting to highhanded and arbitrary practices obsessed with overconfidence of its strength and arrogance. However, this is nothing but desperate efforts of empire on its decline. 
					
					 The world is witnessing the pitiful plight of the U.S. getting close to ruin inch by inch while making desperate efforts to prolong its remaining days.
					
					 The U.S. has no way out and future.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to behave itself, well aware of its poor position.

articles.title: Bird Flu Occurs in Kwangju of S. Korea
articles.content:
Bird Flu Occurs in Kwangju of S. Korea 
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- There occurred bird flu again in Kwangju of south Korea on September 22, according to the south Korean KBS. 
					 It was confirmed that ducks on a farm of Kwangsan District of Kwangju City were infected with bird flu. 
					
					 In September only bird flu occurred in different places of Kwangju and other parts of South Jolla Province and tens of thousands of fowls were culled and buried.

articles.title: WPK's Birthday Observed Abroad
articles.content:
WPK's Birthday Observed Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Events took place abroad in the period between September 19 and 23 on the occasion of the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 They included a seminar and film show in Bangladesh and a week of DPRK film show in Nigeria.
					
					 On display at the venue of the seminar were photos documenting the exploits President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un performed by leading the party-building.
					
					 Participants in the film shows watched Korean films "The Tower of the Juche Idea" and "Monument to Party Founding".
					
					 Rashed Khan Menon, chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh who doubles as minister of Civil Aviation and Tourism, and other personages said that the WPK has led the Korean revolution along the road of victory, taking the great Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism as a permanent guiding idea, and the Korean people are achieving great successes in their struggle for defending the sovereignty of the country and building a thriving socialist nation under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 They went on:
					
					 Under the leadership of the WPK peace and security on the Korean Peninsula have been firmly defended and the DPRK has turned into a politico-ideological power and military power which no formidable enemy dares attack.
					
					 The speakers were confident that the party, government and people of the DPRK would achieve a final victory thanks to the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: WPK Praised by Bangladeshi Political Figure
articles.content:
WPK Praised by Bangladeshi Political Figure
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) founded by President Kim Il Sung has performed great feats in the revolution and construction by steering the struggle of the Korean people as headquarters of the revolution.
					 Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League, said this in a statement on September 23 on the occasion of the 70th founding anniversary of the WPK.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The 70 year-long history of the WPK is a glorious one as it has turned the DPRK into a socialist power and led the cause of human independence to brilliant victory.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il invariably regarded the Juche idea as a guiding idea and led the WPK to successfully perform its mission and role as a guiding force of the Songun cause.
					
					 The WPK having Marshal Kim Jong Un at its top post has honorably defended the sovereignty and dignity of the country by resolutely frustrating all sorts of challenges and moves of the imperialists and waged a dynamic drive for building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 Wishing the WPK greater success, we assure it that we would invariably support the just cause of the Workers' Party and people of Korea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk's Exploits Introduced by German Body
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk's Exploits Introduced by German Body
						
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany posted special write-ups on its website on Sept. 23 on the occasion of the 66th anniversary of demise of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 It posted articles accompanied by photos of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Suk.
					
					 The article titled "Brilliant life" said:
					
					 Embarking upon the road of revolution in her early years, Kim Jong Suk joined the Korean People's Revolutionary Army led by Kim Il Sung in September 1935.
					
					 She earned fame as an anti-Japanese war hero and woman commander of Mt. Paektu and set a brilliant example in devotedly defending the leader.
					
					 Her life was totally dedicated to protecting the safety of the President and implementing his idea and line. Her life was a great one as she gave birth to leader Kim Jong Il, providing steady continuity to the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 An article titled "Yearning for Kim Jong Suk" said:
					
					 She was a crack shot in the battle fought against the enemy and always showed warm loving care for the comrades and people, her face beaming with a broad smile in the period of the anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					
					 After Korea's liberation she visited every nook and corner of the country, dedicating herself to the drive for carrying out the President's line on building the party, state and army.
					
					 She is still remembered by the Korean people as a great paragon in defending the leader unto death.

articles.title: Nigerian Body Discloses U.S. True Colors as Aggressor
articles.content:
Nigerian Body Discloses U.S. True Colors as Aggressor
						
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted on its website articles denouncing the U.S.
					 The article titled "70 years of the U.S. presence in south Korea" on Sept. 9 said:
					
					 For a long period since its occupation of south Korea the U.S. has persisted in its moves to stifle the DPRK while seeking permanent division of the Korean Peninsula quite contrary to the unanimous will and desire of all Koreans for peace and reunification.
					
					 The U.S. should withdraw its forces from south Korea, stop provocative military actions and do the work helpful to peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The website in an article on Sept. 13 cited facts to prove that the U.S. is the aggressor wantonly violating the sovereignty of other countries in disregard of international law and a country of evils which brought unspeakable misfortune and pain to humankind.
					
					 Posted on the website on Sept. 16 were articles under the title "Why U.S. troops are present in south Korea" and subtitles "Aggressor under mask of 'liberator'", "Deceptive fiction about 'peace keeping'" and "Stumbling block lying in way of Korea's reunification." They disclosed the fact that the U.S. that hurled its troops into south Korean under the mask of "liberator" on Sept. 8, 1945, is the chief architect of Korea's division.

articles.title: Escuela secundaria basica de Saemaul
articles.content:
Escuela secundaria basica de Saemaul
						
Pyongyang, 29 de septiembre (ACNC) -- La Escuela Secundaria Basica de Saemaul del capitalino municipio de Phyongchon es conocida por todo el pais como unidad que forma bien a la reserva de los gimnastas.
					La escuela sobresalio en 28 ocasiones en la gimnasia artistica de la Competencia Deportiva Nacional de Jovenes y Ninos Escolares por el Premio Jongilbong, que se efectua  anualmente.
					
					Al tomar como gimnasia artistica la disciplina deportiva especializada, la escuela acondiciono la sala de gimnasia y  soluciono por propia cuenta mas de 200 aparatos deportivos. E instruye de modo cientifico los ejercicios a los alumnos seleccionados.
					
					Al participar a menudo en las competencias capitalinas y nacionales, analizo los puntos positivos y negativos para buscar nuevos metodos de ejercicio, con los cuales ensena a los gimnastas.
					
					Asi soluciono el acoplamiento de gimnastas en el juego colectivo y el movimiento elegante y ritmico de los alumnos en la competencia individual y creo y completo la musica adecuada a la velocidad y el ritmo de todos los movimientos y otros conforme a la tendencia del desarrollo de la gimnasia artistica moderna.
					
					En los exitos logrados por la escuela estan impregnados los esfuerzos incansables y la capacidad de la maestra de deportes Pak Hyang Suk.
					
					Ella trabaja durante casi 40 anos como profesora de deportes y formo a muchas gimnastas, que actuan en todos los equipos  deportivos y obtienen muchas medallas en los juegos  internacionales.
					
					Escribio nuevo manual de entrenamiento de gimnasia artistica e invento medios de ensenaza, asi que adquirio dos certificados del metodo de nueva didactica y el titulo de instructor ejemplar 8 de octubre.

articles.title: Se incrementen nuevas "familias" en Parque Zoologico Nacional
articles.content:
Se incrementen nuevas "familias" en Parque Zoologico Nacional
						
Pyongyang, 29 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Se incrementan nuevas "familias" en el Parque Zoologico Nacional que esta reconstruyendose y ampliandose como base de vida cultural de  los habitantes.
					Este ano, anidan alli mas de 370 animales de mas de 90 generos nuevos.
					
					Entre ellos figuran Hyaena striata, Taurotragus oryx, Cygnus olor, etc.
					
					Y en el Parque Zoologico Nacional fueron multiplicados mas de 400 animales de mas de 100 generos.
